content.question: For time <math alttext="t is greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the velocity of a particle moving along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis is given by <math alttext="v of t, equals, the sine of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The initial position of the particle at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="x equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following gives the total distance the particle travels from time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to time <math alttext="t equals, 3 pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 3 pi, of, the sine of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="5 plus the integral from, 0 to 3 pi, of, the absolute value of, the sine of t, end absolute value, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>|</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 3 pi, of, the absolute value of, the sine of t, end absolute value, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>|</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="5 plus the integral from, 0 to 3 pi, of, the sine of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 3 pi, of, the absolute value of, the sine of t, end absolute value, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>|</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
